skill.name: bark-notify
skill.description: Send Bark (day.app) push notifications after Codex completes a task. Use when one Codex or Claude run is finished, or when you need to notify on task completion with device name, project name, status, and summary.
skill.summary: Send Bark (day.app) push notifications after Codex completes a task. Use when one Codex or Claude ru...
skill.author: caopulan

security_audit.summary: Legitimate notification utility that reads environment variables for API configuration, reads project metadata from AGENTS.md files, and sends push notifications to the official Bark API (api.day.app). No suspicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Send push notifications when tasks complete
content.value_statement: Stay informed about Codex and Claude task completions on your devices. Receive instant push notifications with task status, project name, and results without checking the terminal.
actual_capabilities: Send push notifications to iOS devices via Bark (day.app)
Include device name, project name, task status, and summary in notifications
Read project names from AGENTS.md files or use folder names
Support multiple execution statuses (success, failed, partial, blocked)
Validate required environment variables before sending
Dry-run mode to preview notifications without sending
limitations: Requires Bark app installed and Bark key configured
Only reads AGENTS.md files for project name extraction
Network connectivity required to send notifications
No support for rich notifications with custom icons or actions

use_cases.target_user: Developers running Codex or Claude Code
use_cases.title: Remote task monitoring
use_cases.description: Get notified on your phone when long-running coding tasks finish while you work elsewhere.

use_cases.title: CI/CD completion alerts
use_cases.description: Receive instant alerts when automated builds or deployments complete with status details.

use_cases.title: Workflow completion tracking
use_cases.description: Track multiple task completions across projects with organized notification summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Basic task notification
prompt_templates.scenario: Notify when a coding task finishes
prompt_templates.prompt: Use bark-notify to notify me when this task completes. Task title: "Refactor authentication module". Status: success. Summary: All tests passed, code refactored successfully.

prompt_templates.title: Failure notification
prompt_templates.scenario: Alert on task failure with details
prompt_templates.prompt: Use bark-notify to send a notification if this fails. Task title: "Database migration". Status: failed. Summary: Migration script encountered constraint violation on users table.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-step workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: After completing each step, use bark-notify to update me. Task title: "Deploy to staging". Status: partial. Summary: Build succeeded, deployment in progress.

prompt_templates.title: Custom project name
prompt_templates.prompt: Use bark-notify to notify upon completion. Task title: "Code review completed". Status: success. Summary: All 12 files reviewed. Project name: "Backend API v2".

output_examples.input: Use bark-notify with task title: 'API endpoint implementation', status: success, summary: 'Created 5 REST endpoints with full documentation'
output: Summary: Created 5 REST endpoints with full documentation

best_practices: Configure CODEX_MACHINE_NAME with a descriptive identifier to distinguish multiple machines
Use AGENTS.md with project_name frontmatter for consistent project naming across notifications
Test notifications with --dry-run before relying on them for important task monitoring
anti_patterns: Including sensitive data like API keys, passwords, or personal information in the summary field
Using the same machine name across multiple development environments
Relying on notifications without verifying the Bark key configuration is correct

faq.question: What platforms support Bark notifications?
faq.answer: Bark is an iOS and macOS app. Install it from the App Store, then configure the Bark key from settings.

faq.question: How do I find my Bark key?
faq.answer: Open Bark app, tap your device name, and copy the full URL. The key is the string after api.day.app/.

faq.question: Can I use this with multiple devices?
faq.answer: Yes, create separate Bark keys for each device and switch environment variables as needed.

faq.question: Is my notification data stored securely?
faq.answer: Notifications are sent directly to your device through Apple's push service. No third-party servers.

faq.question: Why is my notification not arriving?
faq.answer: Check that CODEX_BARK_KEY is set correctly, network is available, and Bark app has notification permissions.

faq.question: How is this different from other notification skills?
faq.answer: Bark delivers native iOS/macOS push notifications with no app installation required on the sending side.
